comment.author: 99490033@N02
comment._content: Tai Hang is a village with over 100 years of history with opening to the reclaimed Causeway Bay in north and So Kon Po in west. Its south and east are hills. Today's Victoria Park and Queen's College area of land is reclaimed, the former coastline along Tung Lo Wan Road today. There is a huge from Mount Butler and then flows into the sea, Tai Hang hence the name, which now is known as Tai Hang Canal.

comment.author: 61013804@N08
comment._content: The Hong Kong Album produced by the HK Museum of History has the same photo (3rd ed 1986, p.7). It is labeled as Wong Nei Chung village. Photographed by John Thompson, c. 1865
